reviews.text: Great museum with lots of exhibits describing the history of Singapore and its rise as s world trading power.  Large scale of exhibit showing the jewel of Muscat.  Has a 4D movie theater.  Lots of fun things to do for kids.  Connected to aquarium (requires separate admission)

Well the exhibit looks Fabulous from the outside and would definitely pull you in, but once you get inside it's not something which will bowl you over.

It's just an average place we felt that it could have been skipped as we were on the play max pass and wanted to cover lot of destinations in just a day.

It also has the Pirates exhibit inside which has got some really good photo spots provided your phone can capture great shots in low lighting condition.

WxThey had a major revamp and now the place is thrice as good.  There is several objects and stone busts of people and the layout is good.  However , some of the things, like the show, is a bit old and outdated and it's not really worth the 3 minutes.  The fake pirate attack boat is nice and dry, but smells like rope

The one of a kind exhibition of South East Asian Maritime culture and tradition  timelines. It's very educational and entertaining. Every bit of displays are intricate and collated to offer each guests an amazing experience.
If you wants to experience about Singapore's maritime history and geography, The Maritime Experimental museum is unique place to go. The museum is next door to SEA Aqurium which is you must see
